feed.title: Abe Lincoln's Top Hat (Only new eps)
feed.subtitle: Politics! We know you love them just as much as we do. Join political commentator Ben Kissel and radio man Marcus Parks each week as they discuss what's going on in politics and the world of social issues.

entry.title: Episode 589: Flipping, Flailing, and Flatulating
entry.content: Rounding out this week in Tophat News, Ben, Travis, and Fernando breakdown the headlines including Chris Christie’s “belly flop” of a book release, Chris Cuomo getting canned by CNN, Mississippi abortion news and the effects of the Supreme Court’s decision, a 14 year old victim in the Ghislaine Maxwell case sites Donald Trump, the origins of the Omicron Variant name, shocking Sexual Assault scandals at Liberty University and MORE in this packed episode!Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 588: Not Alright, Alright
entry.content: Tophat returns and this week Ben, Travis, and Fernando share their reactions to the Ahmaud Arbery murder verdict, Ben breaks the news to the gang that Matthew Mcconaughey will sadly NOT be running for Governor in Texas, Lauren Boebert's racist rant caught on tape, COVID travel bans in South Africa, the implications of the US redistricting plans, and MORE.Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 587: Subpoena-Butter and Jelly
entry.content: Ben, Fernando, and Travis serve up a delicious plate of Tophat for this Thanksgiving week, breaking down the headlines including Biden pardoning Turkeys instead of Marijuana Offenders, the Rittenhouse Verdict and it’s implications on the Chrystul Kizer case, the Matt Gaetz trial begins to take shape, January 6th Subpoenas for Alex Jones & Roger Stone, Major Pharmacy’s held responsible for Opioid Crisis in Ohio, why Jeff Bezos donated 100 million to The Obama Foundation... and MORE!Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 586: The Right Thing
entry.content: Ben, Travis, and Fernando bring you this week’s headlines including Julius Jones & his fate in the hands of an Oklahoma Governor, Alex Jones Liable in Sandyhook Case, Infrastructure Bill success, Beto O'Rourke in Texas, Liz Cheney ousted, Gosar vs. AOC, Proud Boy Q-Shaman Jail Updates, A.I. Lie Detection in Court, and MORE!Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 585: In the Midst of History w/ Donte West
entry.content: Ben, Travis, and Fernando bring you a double-shot of Tophat in this week's episode breaking down the headlines including Joe Biden & Fart-Gate 2021, former prison executioners battling PTSD in South Carolina, the Infrastructure Bill & AI Drunk Driving Prevention, Ann Coulter vs. Trump, "big pharma" lobbying against the drug pricing plan, AND to top it all off, we welcome back friend of the show Donte West, for an update on The Last Prisoner Project, his upcoming documentary "The Story of Donte West", and a discussion on the future of Marijuana Legalization in the country.Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 584: Stuck in the Middle
entry.content: Ben, Fernando, and Travis are back with more of this week's top stories including job economy growth in October, The Build Back Better Bill and it's setback with the CBO, James Carville pointing fingers at Wokeness, the Miami Herald enlisting Robot Writers, Igor and the fake Steele Dossier, Gun Control in NY, Rittenhouse juror dismissed for bad jokes, and MORE in this packed episode.Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 583: Big... If True
entry.content: Ben, Travis, and Fernando break down this week's headlines including Glenn Youngkin winning the governor's race (and the implications that has for democrats and the rest of the elections), Qanon supporters left waiting for JFK Jr. in Dallas, current NPR polls on the American trust of elections, and a Russian woman jailed for exposing her booty at The Kremlin.Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 582: Keepin' It Objective w/ Ford Fischer
entry.content: Ben, Fernando, and Travis welcome guest Ford Fischer, Independent Videographer and co-founder of News2share.com, to discuss the importance of objectivity in journalism as well as his experiences working as a citizen journalist during the Unite the Right Rally and the January 6th Insurrection.Ford Fischer is an independent videographer, editor, and computer scientist/web designer. He co-founded and designed News2share.com as an engine for independent videographers and citizen journalists to contribute to the evolving news cycle. He is the editor-in-chief of News2Share. His work has been featured on CNN, Fox, MSNBC, ABC and more. He is currently directing News2Share’s first feature film and is available for hire as a freelance videographer/journalist. Reach him at fordfischervideo@gmail.com Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 581: Whiplash
entry.content: Ben, Fernando, and Travis break down this week's headlines including executions being delayed for Oklahoma death row inmates, the Oathkeepers and their connections to elected officials, Anti-Biden Hip Hop taking iTunes by storm, Approval rating woes continue, the end of the trail for "Cowboys for Trump" leader, and the Reno City Council lashes out against the unauthorized use of Whips.Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 580: Tricycles for Trump w/ The Good Liars
entry.content: Ben, Travis, and Fernando welcome back friends of the show The Good Liars - Jason Selvig & Davram Stiefler (@tglnyc @jasonselvig @davrams) to discuss their latest film "The Supporters" (available Nov 4th at The Supporters ), how Trump rallies have changed since the insurrection, and their experiences interviewing supporters who attend those rallies. - Visit The Good Liars - Patreon for more!Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 579: Livin' on a Prayer
entry.content: Ben, Travis, and Fernando break down this week's headlines including faith leaders holding a prayer vigil for the 3.5 trillion dollar infrastructure bill - also following up on last week's story, Texas school boards clarify their stance on teaching opposing views for the holocaust, the NAACP pushes for AT&T to end One America News, GOP blocking voting rights bills, Schumer siding with the republicans, Bannon held in contempt, and Rudy Guiliani channeling the ghost of Abe Lincoln himself!Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 578: My Ladybugs
entry.content: Ben, Travis, and Fernando are back with this week's headlines including Texas requesting schools show "opposing views" of the Holocaust, Katie Couric's controversial editing of RBG's statements, Armed Robot Dogs, "Q" running for Office, Steve Bannon subpoenaed by the January 6th Panel, Sarah Huckabee is back, and finally... Lindsay Grahams Lady Bugs.Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 577: The Power of Sports w/ Bob Kendrick
entry.content: This week Ben, Fernando, and Travis are joined by historian and host of Black Diamonds Podcast - Bob Kendrick, president of the Negro Leagues Baseball Museum, to discuss #mybaseballmemory, the importance of keeping the story of the Negro Leagues alive, and just how pivotal the game of baseball has been to American Civil History.Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 576: Alright, Alright, Alright
entry.content: Ben, Fernando, and Travis are back for this week's second dose of Top Hat, breaking down Matthew Mcconaughey's possible future in politics, the Jacob Blake shooting verdict, George Floyd's posthumous pardon in Texas, an Anti-Vax Murder Spree in Maryland, Justin Beiber vs. DeepFake Tom Cruise, Microchips in the Air, and Trump proclaiming that Haitians have Aids.Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 575: Cough It Up
entry.content: Ben, Fernando, and Travis breakdown this week's headlines including the COVID-19 Pill fiasco as Merck charges the U.S. a 400% markup, Judge Robert Pitman suspending SB8 in Texas, One America News and it's relationship with AT&T, attention on Trump continuing to fade, the CIA finds itself in hot water over the Abu Zubaydah torture scandal, the CIA's new China Center, and Andrew Yang's new "Forward Party".Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 574: I EAT ASS
entry.content: In this week's follow-up Top Hat, Ben, Fernando, and Travis talk Qualified Immunity in regards to the "I EAT ASS" bumper sticker case in Florida, Alabama using COVID relief funds to build more Prisons, raising concerns of new student monitoring programs as the surveillance state grows, Police officials using Facebook as a Database, as well as Gavin Newsom and the Bruce Beach reparations.Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 573: The Vulcan Centaur
entry.content: Ben, Travis, and Fernando break down this week's headlines including the potentially dangerous new partnership between Space X and The Space Force, Julian Asange revealed to have been in the crosshairs of the CIA, problems in Haiti continue as minimum wage issues are exasperated by American Corporations, Texas denies the mistreatment of Haitian refugees seen in viral photos, and even MORE in this packed episode!Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 572: Blowing the Whistle w/ John Kiriakou
entry.content: In this week's follow-up Top Hat, Ben, Fernando, and Travis sit down with former CIA Intelligence Officer and Whistle Blower, John Kiriakou to discuss the fascinating and heartbreaking story that lead him to become the first US Official to blow the whistle on the Bush administration's Torture Program, the backlash of the scandal, and how his own CIA training helped him survive his time in Prison.Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 571: Take this Job and Shove It
entry.content: Ben, Travis, and Fernando are back to break down this week's headlines as Walmart's mistreatment of workers finds itself in the spotlight courtesy of former employee Beth McGrath, new projections see a surge in the surveillance industry as the government begins to integrate new AI software, growing concerns on the handling of the Texas-Haitian refugee crisis, and more, as the backlash of the Abortion Ban continues in The Lone Star State.Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 570: Do Unto Others
entry.content: Ben, Fernando, and Travis discuss the Kabul strike that killed 10 civilians, the Welcome.US coalition and how effective their scope of Afghan refugee support will be, Haitian refugees rejected at the Texas border, companies no longer testing for cannabis, the Nabisco workers strike, and more!Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 569: The Mute Button
entry.content: Ben, Travis, and Fernando break down this week's political stories including Gavin Newsom surviving the California Recall, General Milley's secret talks with China, Antony Blinken defending the Afghan withdrawal, former National Security Officials speaking out against Antitrust Laws, AOC at the Met Gala, and a tribute to the late, great, Norm MacDonald.Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 568: Twenty Years Gone w/ George W. Bush (James Adomian)
entry.content: Ben, Travis, and Fernando present a very special 9/11 Commemorative Episode and are joined by the 43rd President of the United States, George W. Bush (James Adomian) to look back on the harrowing day that changed America forever, and find out just what Dubya's been up to since.James Adomian Tour Dates:Austin 9/22 - Moontower Comedy Festivalhttps://www.austintheatre.org/moontower-comedy/shows/james-adomian/Des Moines 10/2 - Des Comédie Festivalhttps://desmoinesperformingarts.org/events/james-adomian/Atlanta 11/5 - Red Clay Comedy Festivalhttps://www.redclaycomedy.com/adomianNashville 11/9 - Zanieshttps://nashville.zanies.comOr follow me instagram for LA shows:@JAdomian-Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 567: The Fight Within The Fight
entry.content: Ben, Travis, and Fernando break down this week in Politics, as Trump goes from U.S. President to Ringside Announcer (on 9/11 no less), growing concerns over Financial Surveillance in the U.S. ramps up, Robert Kaplan and the Feds shady dealings make headlines, Ride Sharing Services take official stance on new Abortion Laws, and Larry Elder finds himself on the wrong side of an egging. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 566: Statists Gonna' State
entry.content: Ben, Travis, and Fernando are back with this week's follow-up Top Hat to discuss the top headline stories including the Indictiment of the Police Officers involved in the death of Elijah Mcclain, the Texas Abortion Ban, China's enforced Masculinization, an update on the situation in Afghanistan, Caitlyn Jenner Deblasio's election attempts and MORE in this loaded episode! Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 565: A Voice from The Inside w/ Larry Lawton
entry.content: This week Ben, Travis, and Fernando sit down with Criminal Justice Reform Activist, Author, & Youtube star, Larry Lawton to talk about his experience behind bars and shed some light on the changes that need to be made within the Prison system. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 564: In the Thick of It
entry.content: In this week's follow-up Top Hat, Ben, Travis, and Fernando discuss US Weapons left in Taliban hands, the recent online drama surrounding Roger Stone's accidental ban from the Gettr App, Gavin Newsome and California's Stimulus Checks, a man on "Mail Bender" found with 300 recall ballots, Covid Death Toll Corrections, and the upcoming face reveal of the Officer involved in shooting during January's Capitol Riot's. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 563: A Man and His Dog
entry.content: This week Ben, Travis, and Fernando discuss Andrew Cuomo's resignation from Office as he loses his Emmys and casts his dog to the wayside, the sad state of Riker's Island Prison, Trump receiving boos for backing the Vax, Mask Mandate Debates, Colorado opening it's arms to Afghan refugees, and MORE! Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 562: The Finger of Doom
entry.content: Ben, Travis, and Fernando dive into the rest of this week's headlines including the so-called "attack" on MyPillow CEO Mike Lindell, Facebook bomb threats leading to an arrest on Capitol Hill, Automated Speeding Tickets in Chicago, and the controversial news that OnlyFans will be restricting Sexual Content from it's platform. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 561: Spoils of the Forever War w/ Saman Arbabi
entry.content: Ben, Travis, and Fernando break down the recent devastating events in Afghanistan and are joined by Iranian journalist Saman Arbabi to discuss the Taliban takeover, U.S. withdrawal, and the future for refugees fleeing the country in search of freedom. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 560: The Stories of U.S. w/ Ken Burns
entry.content: In this very special interview, Ben, Travis, and Fernando sit down with acclaimed documentarian and film maker Ken Burns to discuss his new project Muhammad Ali and the important story that inspired the four part series premiering on PBS September 19th. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 559: The United States of Amazon
entry.content: Ben, Travis, and Fernando are back to break down this week's headlines including Microsoft's opposition of a 10 Billion Dollar deal between Amazon and the NSA, the fall of Andrew Cuomo as the governor declares his resignation, Gavin Newsome's Recall election, Infrastructure Bill passing, Crypto Taxing, and more! Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 558: How To Run For Office
entry.content: In this very special episode, Ben, Travis, and Fernando discuss How to Run for Office, what it takes to get involved, and the personal stories of our own host's campaigns captured in Travis's documentaries American Mayor (https://vimeo.com/ondemand/americanmayor) and Hail Yourself America (https://hailyourselfamerica.com/), both available now. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 557: No Bones About It w/ Ken Bone
entry.content: Ben, Travis, and Fernando enter the "Bone Zone" once again as they're joined by returning guest, internet sensation Ken Bone to discuss life, post-meme fame, Ken's honest view of the current state of affairs in our country, and navigating American politics as an "everyman". Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 556: The Politics of Video Game Culture w/ Meg Turney
entry.content: Ben, Travis, and Fernando break down this week's headlines and are joined by Streamer, Internet Personality, and Model, Meg Turney to discuss the evolution of female representation in the gaming industry, maintaining balanced parasocial interaction as a creator, the possible psychological benefits of gaming as well as how they can be used for manipulation and MORE. Check out Meg's Twitch & Instagram! https://www.twitch.tv/megturney https://www.instagram.com/megturney/?hl=en Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 555: Mischief-Makers
entry.content: Ben, Fernando, and Travis are all back together for this week's episode to discuss the assassination of Haitian President Jovenel Moïse, new hope for federal marijuana reform in the states, Lindsey Graham goes to war for Chicken Sandwiches, and Trump goes head to head with comedy. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 554: Bohemian Grove 2.0
entry.content: Ben, Travis, and Fernando dive into an array of the recent Political happenings as Sun Valley hosts a shady, 2 day Billionaire Summer Camp, Trump files a lawsuit against Facebook, A.I. “Drone Swarms” in Israel pose new threats to security, former Stormy Daniels attorney Michael Avenatti heads to prison for attempting to extort Nike, Trump’s Twitter knockoff app “Gettr” launches and immediately gets hacked, the fall of Rudy Giuliani continues, and lastly, Travis reads some of the amazing messages being sent to Representative Seitz after last week’s episode. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 553: A Comic-Con of Chaos
entry.content: With so much going on in the world this week, Ben, Travis, and Fernando are back, this time to discuss Maine passing the strongest ban on Facial Recognition seen to date, Aerial drone programs being deemed unconstitutional, Amazon finding themselves under fire again for mistreatment of workers, the ongoing investigation into the cause of the pandemic, Federal Marijuana restrictions & the Olympics, the Surfside tower collapse, and MORE as Travis enlists the help of the Top Hat community once again... Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 552: Fight for your Reproductive Rights w/ Ellie Rushforth
entry.content: Ben, Fernando, and Travis are joined by ACLU Attorney Ellie Rushford to discuss Reproductive Rights in the US, the struggle to find proper healthcare for the less privileged, reports of forced medical procedures on immigrants, and breaking the overall stigma around Abortion in modern times. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 551: Cruel Games w/ Pete Paxton
entry.content: This week Ben, Fernando, and Travis are joined by returning guest, Undercover Investigator and Animal Rights Advocate Pete Paxton to discuss his new book "Rescue Dogs" and some of the terrible things currently happening in regards to animal abuse, particularly in Grey Hound Racing, Puppy Mills, and how the meat industry's irresponsibility is creating new risks of spreading disease. Also, our hosts discuss the recent authorization of the National Guard to use lethal force, as well as a breakdown of the Derek Chauvin sentencing. Link to sign a petition to ban greyhound racing, and see the video of evidence: https://www.grey2kusa.org/index.php Link to see the case about Animal Disease Traceability and the beef/dairy connection: https://www.seedundercoverinvestigations.com/ Link to learn about puppy mills and pet stores: https://www.caps-web.org/ Pete Paxton's book, Rescue Dogs, is available on Amazon and at Barnes and Noble. Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 550: Monsters Inc.
entry.content: Ben, Fernando, and Travis are back for a little bonus Top Hat to discuss yet another ironically surnamed politician who has found themselves in the headlines for poor yet unsurprising behavior, Trump's comments on sending COVID infected tourists to Guantanamo Bay (as performed by Travis Irvine), Texas prisons clearing room for illegal immigrants, and a breakdown of the long overdue NCAA ruling. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 549: The Chicken or the Egg w/ Salim Essaid
entry.content: Ben, Fernando, and Travis breakdown the week's political headlines including Top Hat listeners answering the literal call to action against Larry Householder, the possibility/consequences of the virus being the result of a lab accident, Juneteenth/Critical Race Theory in America, as well as an in depth discussion with TV Reporter and Journalist, Salim Essaid about the ongoing struggle of life in Palestine. About our guest: Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/salim_essaid/ Twitter: https://twitter.com/salimessaid LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/salimessaid/ Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 548: Fighting the Good Fight w/ Donte West
entry.content: Ben, Fernando, and Travis return to discuss this week's Political News and ask the question: What's going on with Trump's pants?! Also we're joined by Anti Incarceration Advocate Donte West of the Last Prisoner Project to discuss his experience with the Criminal Justice System, Marijuana law reform, and the the Last Prisoner Project's mission to help free those incarcerated for Marijuana related arrests. To Find out more please visit: https://www.lastprisonerproject.org/ Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 547: Swiss Army Mania
entry.content: This week Ben, Travis, and Fernando discuss the recent overturning on the ban of AR-15s in California and the complexities of what it would take to truly maintain Gun Control in today's country, as well their thoughts on the new controversial facial recognition software being introduced at US Southern Borders. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 546: Commission Dismission
entry.content: Ben, Travis, and Fernando discuss the recent events in the Senate as Republicans block the independent commission to investigate the Jan 6th events at The Capital. Fernando drops some hot-takes on why the commission isn't necessary, Ben battles the Buffalo shrimp blues, and Travis recounts his days as a young intern for Chuck Schumer. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0 Learn more about your ad choices. Visit podcastchoices.com/adchoices

entry.title: Episode 545: Unaccountability in the Air
entry.content:
Ben, Travis, and Fernando break down this week's political landscape as the UFO phenomenon smokescreens important issues, Travis highlights the ramifications of the Pentagon having never been audited, as well as an update on the devastating conflict between Israel and Palestine.
Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 544: Scandal Season
entry.content:
This week Ben, Travis, and Fernando break down the scandalous state of affairs as Matt Gaetz is caught in a compromising situation, along with The Coastal Pipeline hack and our host's speculation on just who could be responsible for the damaging cyber attack (we’re looking at you Putin…)…
Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 543: Menthol Desire
entry.content: Ben, Travis, and Fernando discuss Stacy Abrams novels, the smoking ban in New Zealand, menthol ban in the USA, and juror 52. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 542: Bernie Sanders Hole
entry.content: Ben, Travis and Fernando discuss Biden pitching his 100 day In-Office Agenda to Congress, Matt Gaetz and Marjorie Taylor Greene’s ‘America First Tour’, and Gavin Newsom’s recall election. entry.title: Episode 541: Celebrity in Chief
entry.content: Ben, Travis and Fernando discuss the Chauvin verdict and the new crop of celebrities running for office. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.content: Ben, Travis and Fernando discuss the shooting of Daunte Wright, the push to decriminalize psilocybin, and the timeline for troop withdrawals from Afghanistan. entry.content: Ben, Fernando and Travis discuss the push for federal legalization of marijuana, Matt Gaetz's continuing legal woes, and a corporate pushback to Georgia's voting laws. entry.title: Episode 538: Dehydrate the Vote
entry.content: Ben, Fernando and Travis discuss Matt Gaetz's child trafficking investigation, the Derek Chauvin trial, and a renewed GOP push to disenfranchise voters. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 537: Political Pretzels
entry.content: Ben, Fernando & Travis Irvine discuss the debate over gun control, the H.R.1 bill and Roger Stone's involvement in the January 6th insurrection. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 536: Once You Pop, You Can't Stop
entry.content: Ben, Fernando and Travis Irvine discuss the shootings in Atlanta, Utah's anti-porn bill and potential changes coming to filibuster laws. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 535: #Ben
entry.content: Ben and Fernando are joined by Travis Irvine to discuss racial profiling in big tech, conservatives pushing back against "cancel culture" and Georgia opening a criminal investigation against Trump. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 534: Everything Old is New Again
entry.content: Ben and Fernando discuss the stimulus bill, child detention centers, and the Derek Chauvin trial. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 533: Hammer & Nails w/ The Liberal Rednecks
entry.content: Ben and Fernando are joined by Trae Crowder and Drew Morgan (The Liberal Redneck Manifesto, The wellRed Podcast) to discuss Syria, business as usual under Biden, and how to engage underserved voters Check out more of Trae & Drew's work at WellRedComedy.com Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 532: New Dog in Town
entry.content: Ben and Travis discuss the continuing crisis in Texas, Trump's planned speech for CPAC, and Biden's updated ICE policies. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 531: Stinky Rage
entry.content: Ben and Travis discuss the fallout from the impeachment trial, a scandal brewing at the Lincoln Project, and the recall Gavin Newsome movement. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 530: Eagle Down with Jessica Donati
entry.content: Ben and Travis are joined by journalist Jessica Donati to discuss her work in the Middle East, the forever war, and her book "Eagle Down: The Last Special Forces Fighting the Forever War". entry.content: Ben and Travis recap Biden's first week in office. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.content: This week, a very special double interview episode! Ben is first joined by Devram Stiefler & Jason Selvig (The Good Liars) to discuss their on the ground experiences at the Capitol storming. Then Ben is joined by Thomas View (QAnon Anonymous) to discuss the QAnon movement. entry.content: We discuss today's violent occupation of the Capitol. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.content: Ben and Fernando discuss Trump's politicization of the census and the future for Latino voters. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 523: The Floating Weasel
entry.content: Ben and Travis break down Biden's cabinet picks. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 522: Trickle Down Tragedy
entry.content: This week: the Covid-19 vaccine, water being traded as a commodity and new drone legislation. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 521: The Grinch
entry.content: Ben and Travis discuss the upcoming Georgia election, marijuana decriminalization, and Trump's alleged voter fraud cases. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 520: Daddy in Chief w/ Brooke Rogers
entry.content: Ben is joined by Brooke Rogers to discuss her article in the New York Post, "You’re Not My Dad, Gov. Cuomo — & please stop pretending". Check out Brooke's podcast Xxceedingly Persuasive wherever you get your podcasts! Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 519: Feeding the Tulpa w/ Dr. Fitrakis
entry.content: Ben is joined by Dr. Robert Fitrakis to discuss the fallout from the 2020 election. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 518: The Hell Room
entry.content: Ben and Travis discuss voter fraud claims, prank phone calls and Biden's cabinet picks. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 517: The 1st Step
entry.content: We discuss Joe Biden & Kamala Harris' victory. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 516: Face Off
entry.content: We're all tired of the election, so in this lighter episode we discuss Chris Christie cameos and celebrity endorsements. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 515: Must Flee TV w/ The Good Liars
entry.content: Ben is joined by Jason Selvig and Davram Steifler to discuss their new movie "The Supporters" Learn more at TheSupportersMovie.com or on their Patreon, Patreon.com/TheGoodLiars Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 514: Shake It Up
entry.content: Ben and Travis discuss the dueling Trump/Biden town halls and some exciting Senate races to watch. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 513: Hubba Hubba Politics
entry.content: Ben and Travis recap the VP debates and discuss the attempted abduction of Gov. Whitmer. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 512: An October of Surprises
entry.content: We talk about Trump's Covid diagnosis, voter suppression attempts and Trump's taxes. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 511: The Data is Us w/ Joe Toscano
entry.content: Ben is joined by Joe Toscano (Automating Humanity) to discuss the necessity of updating America's infrastructure, the proliferation of propaganda on social media and how cities are changing in the era of Covid. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 510: To the Victor Go the Spoils
entry.content: We discuss the passing of Justice Ruth Bader Ginsburg. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 509: The Unpolitician w/ Jo Jorgensen
entry.content: Ben is joined by the libertarian candidate for president Jo Jorgensen and they discuss her policies, campaigning during a pandemic, and her background in psychology. Find out more about Jo at Jo20.com Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 508: Triller
entry.content: Ben and Travis discuss an update to our story on inmate firefighters, the CDC's eviction moratorium and the latest social media sensation. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 507: A Tale of Two Conventions
entry.content: Ben and Travis recap the RNC and the DNC and discuss the ongoing protests in Kenosha following the police shooting of Jacob Blake. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 506: Power vs The Powerless w/ The Lucas Brothers
entry.content: Ben is joined by The Lucas Brothers to discuss their upcoming film "Judas and the Black Messiah", the life and assassination of Black Panther Fred Hampton and Hollywood's disneyfication of the civil rights movement. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 505: The Fight for the Middle
entry.content: We discuss Kamala Harris joining Biden's ticket and Trump's continuing attacks on the USPS. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 504: Scoochin for a Mnuchin
entry.content: We cover the 4 executive orders signed by Trump this week, the Beirut explosion and Biden's latest gaffe. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 503: The HEELS Act
entry.content: We discuss the HEALS act, Congress's big tech hearing, and how the pandemic is worsening the affordable housing crisis. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 502: Mr. Makes Things Sloppy
entry.content: We discuss the ending of federal unemployment benefits and how resentment fuels Trump's base. Kevin MacLeod (incompetech.com) Licensed under Creative Commons: By Attribution 3.0 License creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0

entry.title: Episode 501: Build Back Better
entry.content: We discuss the deployment of unmarked federal police in Portland, Biden's new campaign slogan, and a new ruling from SCOTUS on felon voting rights.

entry.title: Episode 500: Shuffle the Deck
entry.content: We discuss this week's Supreme Court rulings, the latest polling data, and how the Trump administration is encouraging brain drain by refusing foreign students visas.

entry.title: Episode 499: America's Magnificent Liberty
entry.content: We celebrate the Fourth of July by discussing Trump's rally at Mt. Rushmore, price gouging on Coronavirus treatments, and who Biden is eyeing for VP.

entry.title: Episode 498: That's So Scary!
entry.content: Ben and Travis discuss white nationalism in the military, the murder of David Patrick Underwood and racial issues with facial recognition software. Check out www.BanFacialRecognition.com to learn more and sign the petition.

entry.title: Episode 497: Subpoena Me Harder!
entry.content: Ben and Travis are joined by Brooke Rogers to discuss Trump's rally in Tulsa, new studies on the effects of armed security in schools and "The Room Where It Happened". Check out Brooke's article in the Washington Examiner, "Gathering Acorns in Quarantine"

entry.title: Episode 496: Scorched Earth Politics
entry.content: Ben and Travis discussed the toppling of Confederate statues, the trickle-down of weapons from the military to the police and the Capitol Hill Autonomous Zone.

entry.title: Episode 495: Believe What You Hear, Believe What You See
entry.content: Ben and Travis recap this past week of BLM protests, the alarming use of unidentified military and police in DC and General Mattis' condemnation of Trump.

entry.title: Episode 494: MAGA Night
entry.content: Ben and Travis cover the murder of George Floyd, the resulting protests, and Trump advocating for violence against US citizens.

entry.title: Episode 493: Victim in Chief
entry.content: Ben and Travis discuss the HEROES Act, Biden's latest gaffe and Amazon cutting employee's hazard pay.

entry.title: Best of Top Hat: Marianne Williamson
entry.content: We revisit our 2019 interview with author, spiritualist and politician Marianne Williamson. Listen to the full episode! Search for Episode 451: The Politics of Love.

entry.title: Episode 492: A Tyrant You Can Trust with Vermin Supreme
entry.content: Ben and Travis are joined by presidential candidate and activist Vermin Supreme and they talk about his Baltimore beginnings, running as a libertarian and the importance of being in on the joke. Learn more about Vermin's campaign at VerminSupreme2020.com

entry.title: Best of Top Hat: Ken Bone
entry.content: We revisit our 2019 interview with Ken Bone and discuss social media negativity bleeding into politics, Ken's experience with becoming a meme and who he's eyeing for 2020. Listen to the rest of the episode! Search for Episode 441: Failing Up

entry.title: Episode 491: Winners Write History
entry.content: Ben and Travis discuss the failed assassination attempt on Nicolás Maduro, New York City targeting people of color for social distancing violations and a Supreme Court toilet flush.

entry.title: Best of Top Hat: Joe Toscano
entry.content: We revisit our interview with Joe Toscano from Episode 418: Clunky Titanic. We discuss Joe's book "Automating Humanity", UBI and a lack of federal oversight in the tech industry. Visit Joe's non-profit DesignGood.tech to learn more about better business practices on the internet.

entry.title: Episode 490: The Long Game
entry.content: Ben and Travis discuss Georgia reopening businesses, Hillary Clinton's endorsement, and Tara Reade's sexual assault allegations against Biden.

entry.title: Best of Top Hat: Ben Westhoff
entry.content: We revisit our interview from Episode 403: Fentanyl Inc with writer Ben Westhoff and we discuss the opioid crisis, big pharma and Ben's book "Fentanyl Inc".

entry.title: Episode 489: Never Tell
entry.content: Ben and Travis talk astroturfing, big businesses exploiting loopholes in small business relief funds and Biden's lackluster response to Coronavirus.

entry.title: Best of Top Hat: Andrew Yang
entry.content: We revisit our interview with Andrew Yang! To listen to the whole episode search for Episode 431: Nothing is on the Level.

entry.title: Episode 488: The Politics of Spite
entry.content: We cover the protests in Michigan, states making regional Coronavirus pacts, and Trump withdrawing funding from the WHO. We are then joined by David Daley to discuss his work covering gerrymandering and redistricting.

entry.title: Best of Top Hat: You Have the Key with Marc Mero
entry.content: We revisit our episode with Marc Mero and we discuss Marc's post-wrestling career as a motivational speaker, the challenges and rewards in connecting with today's youth and the bright futures for the new generation of retired wrestlers. For more information about Marc's motivational programs, visit https://thinkpoz.org

entry.title: Episode 487: The Name of the Game
entry.content: Ben and Travis cover the Wisconsin primary, small businesses getting left behind by banks, and Coronavirus conspiracy theories.

entry.title: Episode 486: Volunteerism is Resistance
entry.content: Ben and Travis breakdown the politicians profiteering from Coronavirus, Tara Reid's allegations against Joe Biden and Midwestern primary polling data They are then joined by Liz Baldwin and Morgan Sykes of Corona Couriers, who deliver supplies to at-risk and homebound people. Support Corona Couriers! Email coronacourier@protonmail.com or donate via Venmo @Sasha-Verma

entry.title: Episode 485: No Tragedy Goes Unused
entry.content: Ben and Travis unpack the grim ways the Coronavirus is allowing the Department of Justice to expand their powers and how the $2 trillion stimulus bill benefits corporations more than the American people. Join us in donating to One Fair Wage or the Restaurant Workers’ Community Foundation to help the unemployed.

entry.title: Episode 484: Silver Linings
entry.content: Ben and Travis catch you up on Covid-19, the death throes of the Sander's campaign and the republican party pivoting to endorse UBI. Check out Ben's documentary Hail Yourself America!

entry.title: Episode 483: We Didn't Start the Fire
entry.content: Ben, Travis and special co-host Travis Irvine (Hail Yourself America) are joined by Morgan Harper, a candidate for Ohio's 3rd district, to discuss gerrymandering, millennials running for office and the new wave of young progressives running against the democratic establishment. Learn more about Morgan's campaign at MorganHarper.org

entry.title: Episode 482: The Malarkey Has Hit the Fan
entry.content: Ben and Travis do a roundup of all the upsets from the past week, from Biden's sweep on Super Tuesday to the abrupt narrowing of the democratic field.

entry.title: Episode 481: Trim the Fat
entry.content: Ben and Travis discuss the South Carolina primary results, the Afghan peace plan and Pence taking the lead on the government's response to the Coronavirus.

entry.title: Episode 480: The Gloves Are Off
entry.content: Ben and Travis discuss all the political action occurring in Nevada this week, from the debate to the caucus results.

entry.title: Episode 479: Dirty Tricks w/ Dylan Bank
entry.content: Ben and Travis sit down with filmmaker Dylan Bank to discuss his documentary "Get Me Roger Stone".
